org.openstreetmap.osm.data.coordinates
Class LatLon

java.lang.Object
  org.openstreetmap.osm.data.coordinates.Coordinate
      org.openstreetmap.osm.data.coordinates.LatLon
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
public class LatLon
extends Coordinate
implements java.io.Serializable, java.io.Externalizable

LatLon are unprojected latitude / longitude coordinates. This class is immutable.

Author:
Imi
See Also:

equalsEpsilon

public boolean equalsEpsilon(LatLon other)
Parameters:
other - the LatLon to compare against
Returns:
true, if the other point has almost the same lat/lon values, only differ by no more than 1/Projection.MAX_SERVER_PRECISION.

isOutSideWorld

public boolean isOutSideWorld()
Returns:
true, if the coordinate is outside the world, compared by using lat/lon.

isWithin

Parameters:
b - the bounds to check against
Returns:
true if this is within the given bounding box.

distanceInMeters

public static double distanceInMeters(double lat1,
                                      double lon1,
                                      double lat2,
                                      double lon2)
Computes the distance between this lat/lon and another point on the earth. Uses spherical law of cosines formula, not Haversine. Earth is ellipsoid. see http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/gis-faq-5.1.html

Parameters:
lat1 - the first point.
lon1 - the first point.
lat2 - the second point.
lon2 - the second point.
Returns:
distance in metres.

                                      LatLon point2)
Computes the distance between this lat/lon and another point on the earth. Uses spherical law of cosines formula, not Haversine. Earth is ellipsoid. see http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/gis-faq-5.1.html

Parameters:
point1 - the first point.
point2 - the second point.
Returns:
distance in metres.

distanceInMeters

public static double distanceInMeters(org.openstreetmap.osmosis.core.domain.v0_6.Node point1,
                                      org.openstreetmap.osmosis.core.domain.v0_6.Node point2)
Computes the distance between this lat/lon and another point on the earth. Uses spherical law of cosines formula, not Haversine. Earth is ellipsoid. see http://www.movable-type.co.uk/scripts/gis-faq-5.1.html

Parameters:

point2 - the second point.
Returns:
distance in metres.

deriveCourse

public static double deriveCourse(double lat1,
                                  double lon1,
                                  double lat2,
                                  double lon2)
Calculate course from dLat and dLon. dLat = lat2 - lat1; dLon = lon2 - lon1.

Parameters:
lat1 - latitude of first point
lon1 - longitude of first point
lat2 - latitude of second point
lon2 - longitude of second point
Returns:
the course (direction) in degrees
